# Bylaws of Durion Solutions, Inc.

*A Delaware Public Benefit Corporation*  
*Wholly owned by the Tire Industry Open Technology Foundation*

---

## ARTICLE I – OFFICES

The principal office and any additional offices shall be designated by the Board
of Directors.

---

## ARTICLE II – SHAREHOLDER

### Section 1. Sole Shareholder

TIOTF is the sole shareholder of Durion.

No shares may be transferred, pledged, or sold except to TIOTF or a
TIOTF-approved successor.

---

## ARTICLE III – BOARD OPERATIONS

### Section 1. Composition

- Three (3) Directors
- Appointed and removable at will by TIOTF

### Section 2. Meetings

- Quarterly meetings required
- Remote participation permitted
- Special meetings may be called by any Director or TIOTF

### Section 3. Quorum and Voting

- Quorum: two Directors
- Majority vote: ordinary business
- Two-thirds vote + TIOTF approval required for:
  - bylaw amendments,
  - proprietary modules,
  - capital expenditures,
  - international entity formation,
  - mission changes.

---

## ARTICLE IV – OFFICERS

### Required Officers

- CEO
- CTO
- CSO
- CFO

CEO and CFO may not be the same individual.

Officers are appointed and removed by the Board.

---

## ARTICLE V – FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT

- Fiscal year set by the Board
- Independent annual audit or review
- Dividends payable **only to TIOTF**
- No individual profit distribution permitted

---

## ARTICLE VI – INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

Durion:

- does not own TIOTF IP,
- may develop proprietary tools only with TIOTF approval,
- must comply with TIOTF CLA and licensing rules when contributing OSS.

---

## ARTICLE VII – PUBLIC BENEFIT REPORTING

Durion shall produce a public benefit report at least biennially, or annually if
requested by TIOTF, describing:

- mission alignment,
- stakeholder impact,
- balance of profit and public benefit.

---

## ARTICLE VIII – INDEMNIFICATION

Directors, officers, and employees shall be indemnified to the fullest extent
permitted by Delaware law.

---

## ARTICLE IX – INTERNATIONAL OPERATIONS

Durion may operate internationally subject to:

- TIOTF approval,
- mission lock compliance,
- applicable cybersecurity, export, and data laws.

---

## ARTICLE X – AMENDMENTS

These Bylaws may be amended only by:

- two-thirds vote of the Durion Board, **and**
- approval of the TIOTF Board.

No amendment may weaken:

- TIOTF ownership,
- mission lock,
- public benefit obligations,
- restrictions on outside investment.
